title: Firefox ill-advised Printer Dialog Box missing 8 functions
content:
I am a writer. The throw-away printer dialog box Firefox uses does not meet my needs. There are about 8 additional functions that Firefox (Mozilla) printer Dialog Box does not have that Windows provides. I see that Firefox (Mozilla) printer Dialog Box can get me to the Windows printer Dialog Box but do you realize what a hassle that is when I an proofing a document. There has to be some method to permanently direct me to the Windows printer Dialog Box when I use the Firefox printer icon. I used one solution and it worked while Firefox was active but went away when I shut down Firefox. When I brought Firefox back online and tried to print, I was sent to the Firefox (Mozilla) printer Dialog Box. That solution didn't help much. I am using 64-bit windows 11.

Also, why did Firefox try to re-create the wheel that was working just fine?
creator: jelitch

title: Using an older version of Firefox can corrupt bookmarks and browsing history already saved to an existing Firefox profile. To protect your information, create a new profile for this installation of Firefox.
content:
Hello, I have been getting this error across the board, on my personal computer and work computer when using Firefox. I've tried everything I've seen that was supposed to be a fix but it still breaks after a day or two and we have multiple clients complaints on the issue too.

"Using an older version of Firefox can corrupt bookmarks and browsing history already saved to an existing Firefox profile. To protect your information, create a new profile for this installation of Firefox."

I have tried: -uninstalling/reinstalling newest version of Firefox -using run, firefox -p to open the profile -creating a new profile altogether -setting my default profile

Please let me know if there is something else we can try or a fix out there I haven't found.

title: Left handed swap mouse buttons - CTRL + primary doesn't work
content:
Hi

I'm using Firefox on Windows 10.

Normally within Firefox, pressing CTRL + left click opens a tab in a new background window.

I'm left handed and use the mouse in my left hand. So I swap the left and right mouse buttons around within Windows settings, so the right mouse button is my primary button. I would then expect CTRL + right click to now open a tab in a new background window, but it doesn't. The CTRL is ignored.

Does anyone know how I can configure Firefox so that the behaviour is consistent, whichever button is the primary one?

Thanks.

title: URLs don't work - i.e. clicking on Pocket articles;  or "open link" from email client
content:
Firefox has been crashing a lot lately, both on my old and new machines. (Mac - now Monterey.) Today it would not open after a crash, so I downloaded a new version (97.0.1). It doesn't really work at all. It shows Pocket articles, but won't take me TO articles. It also won't open links from my email client.

It would be very awkward to copy Pocket articles to another browser, but far too many links don't show the whole article. Today it also did not transfer my bookmarks to the new browser.

Firefox ​has long been my preferred browser, but I find that sites increasingly don’t use Firefox-friendly code. Is it time to give up on it? I also find your bug-reporting process to be incomprehensible.

title: Regardless of settings, Login Emails are Always Present
content:
No Matter What I Do, Firefox will constantly have email login addresses available to forms.

I've tried resetting Privacy Settings, and also will hit "Shift + Delete" to remove the login email(s).

However, after I login 1 single time, the email address is once again available for someone to easily see.

This makes Firefox 100% UNSAFE to use when logging into websites such as Financial, Medical, and plain & simple... Everything.

Is there any way to stop this from happening?!?
